TextView.android:text: Python lists are one of the 4 built-in data types, these are the Sets, Lists, Tuples and Dictionary. These data types are used to store collections data.
Python lists are changeable, have ordered elements, and allow you to store duplicate elements.
List is created by placing elements inside square brackets [ ], elements are separated by comma.
A list can contain different data types.
In this list contains Strings, Integers, Float and Boolean.
A list can also have a another list inside the list, This is called a Nested List
Accessing elements of a list is done by using index operator [ ] and referring the index number. In Python, Index starts at 0 meaning the first element has index of 0.
Remember that the index number must use int to access the element. float, complex and other types are not allowed.
Negative Indexing means start from the end
-1 refers to the last element, -2 refers to the second last element, and so on.
Using the colon (:), we can access the range of an element in a list.
List is changeable. To change the value of a element, you can use its index number
To add element on a list, you can use append() method add to the end of the list.
The insert() method insert element at the specific index.
The extend() method insert several element to the list.
The remove() method removes the specific element to the list.
The pop() method removes element the specific index.
If you do not specify the index inside the pop() method, it removes the last element of the list
The del keyword also removes element the specific index.
Be careful using del keyword, make sure add specific index if not it will delete entire list
The clear() method will empthy the entire list. The list still exist but no element inside in it.
